properties.description: Derby Libraries will be providing warm spaces with extra seating and free hot drinks to support communities with the cost of living this winter. The spaces will be available to all to relax and connect in a safe, warm, welcoming space. Library staff will be on hand to support people who want to join the library and borrow books as well as sign post people to support and trusted information on the cost of living. There will also be opportunities for people to access a busy regular programme of free activities in the libraries from family rhymetimes to adult book groups. To protect the planet and reduce the use of plastic people are encouraged to bring their own cups into libraries. Everyone is welcome to unlimited refills of tea and coffee. Hot drinks will be available Tuesdays 10am – 12 and Fridays 10am -12
properties.title: Alvaston Library

properties.address: Derby City Council, Derby, Derbyshire DE23 1PT

To protect the planet and reduce the use of plastic people are encouraged to bring their own cups into the libraries. Everyone is welcome to unlimited refills of tea and coffee. Hot drinks will be available Thursday 10-1pm.

properties.description: Everyone is welcome. This is an accessible place where refreshments and hot meals are freely available. We can also assist with the Cost of Living Crisis financial challenges and emergency food parcels.
properties.title: Sinfin Moor Church Centre - Community Meals

properties.description: Open from 9.30am to 1.30pm We are open from 9.30am serving free simple breakfasts and then at 12.30pm a free lunch is served. Whether you just need a change of scenery or need to charge your phone, simply chat to someone or need a meal you will be very welcome. We also provide advice regarding accessing support with the cost of living.
